Essential tremor

A tremor is when you’re not able to control shaking or trembling in part of your body. If tremor is affecting your life, treatment may help to reduce it.

What is essential tremor?

Essential tremor is a condition that makes parts of your body shake when you’re trying to use them. Most of the time, it affects your hands when you’re doing tasks that require careful movements, like writing or using a spoon. It’s different from Parkinson’s disease and is actually much more common. Although it often shows up as people get older, it can start at any age.

Who gets essential tremor?

We’re not 100% sure why essential tremor happens, but it often runs in families.

How is it diagnosed?

Usually, doctors can tell if you have essential tremor by talking to you about your symptoms and examining you. Right now, there’s no cure, but there are medicines like beta-blockers that can help manage the shaking. In some cases, a surgical treatment called deep brain stimulation can be considered.
